column1: Progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy (PML) is a rare infection that damages the material (myelin) that covers and protects nerves in the white matter of the brain.
Such medicines may be used to prevent organ transplant rejection or to treat multiple sclerosis, rheumatoid arthritis, and related conditions.
Tests may include: - Brain biopsy (rare) - Cerebrospinal fluid test for the JCV - CT scan of the brain - Electroencephalogram (EEG) - MRI of the brain
In people with AIDS, treatment to strengthen the immune system can lead to recovery from the symptoms of PML.
